TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG for Medical Practitioners ( FAC GPE ) imposed a fine amounting to MONEY ( “ DEM ” ) upon the applicant , an ophthalmologist , for disregarding the ban on advertising under the relevant provisions of GPE ( Berufsordnung der Landesärztekammer ) and LAW on the Councils for the Medical Professions ( HeilberufeKammergesetz ) .

CARDINAL . In its reasoning , ORG found that the applicant performed medical operations with a laser technique . In the house where he had his consultation rooms , his wife ran an “ excimer - laser - centre ” . In DATE the journalist PERSON of the newspaper ORG had visited the applicant , upon appointment , in his consultation rooms and discussed his new laser operation technique . Moreover , a photograph was taken of the applicant at his place of work . On DATE , there had appeared in the said newspaper an article signed by PERSON and entitled “ GPE under fire DATE laser restores full vision . In GPE , the ‘ photorefractive ORG has been applied since DATE operation risks are low - expenses are partly reimbursed by the insurances ” ( “ PERSON unter Beschuss – Laser gibt dem Auge die PERSON . In GPE wird LOC die ‘ ORG angewandt – NORP sind gering – Kosten werden teilweise von den GPE übernommen . ” ) . In the article , it had been inter alia stated that , according to his indications , the applicant had treated CARDINAL patients having defective vision with a laser technique and that in no case had any subsequent corrective measures been necessary and that accordingly he had a success rate of PERCENT . The article had also reported the applicant ’s statement that the long - term success of an operation depended upon the experience of the medical practitioner and on the selection of the patients . The article had been illustrated by a photograph of QUANTITY in size which showed the applicant at his computer pointing to the monitor . It had the caption : “ On the occasion of the ‘ mapping’ Dr PERSON sees on the monitor of his computer whether or not the patient can be treated with the laser technique ” ( “ PERSON ‘ ORG sieht Dr. PERSON dem Monitor seines Computers , ob ein Patient mit dem Laser behandelt werden kann . ” ) .

CARDINAL . ORG considered that the applicant had thereby disregarded sections PERSON ) and CARDINAL of ORG ( see below , Relevant domestic law , paragraph CARDINAL ) . Thus , according to section PERSON ) , a medical practitioner should not allow for picture - stories to be published in respect of his professional activities which had an advertising character , indicated the name and showed a photograph . According to section CARDINAL , the cooperation of a medical practitioner in informative publications in the press was only permissible if these publications were limited to objective information and if the person and the activities of the practitioner were not presented in the form of an advertisement . In press interviews , the medical practitioner was held to “ responsible objectivity ” ( “ verantwortungsbewusste GPE ” ) .

CARDINAL . According to the ORG , the applicant had disregarded these rules in that he had , in the interview , stressed having treated CARDINAL patients and had had a success rate of PERCENT . He had thereby mainly aimed at giving prominence to his own person . This was confirmed by his remark about his professional experience . Likewise , the large photograph , showing the applicant in his medical coat posing as lecturer in front of his computer , went beyond the permissible limits of objective information , as , together with the self - praise found in the text , the message was conveyed that the applicant was a particularly experienced medical practitioner . The applicant should have negotiated with the reporter the objective character of the publication and the size of the photograph in order to comply with the ban on advertising .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( GPE ) dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . ORG confirmed the facts established by ORG and its legal reasoning .

CARDINAL . ORG considered in particular that in order to give effect to the ban on advertisement as laid down in section GPE ) of LAW , cooperation with the press had to be prohibited to the extent that publications had an advertising character ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) . No less restrictive measure was available . The wording of a publication could disguise its advertising character and thus be a means to circumvent the ban on prohibition .

CARDINAL . Having regard to the circumstances of the interview and the presentation of the article , ORG further considered that the applicant had not only tolerated that an article was published which would go beyond objective information on a particular operation technique , but had deliberately acted so as to give prominence to his own person . ORG also stated that , having regard to the interests of his colleagues , the ban on advertising outweighed the applicant ’s freedom to exercise his profession .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to admit his constitutional complaint . The decision was served on DATE .

CARDINAL . In GPE , the medical profession is governed partly by Federal law and partly by the law of the Länder . The principal rules relevant for the present case are to be found in ORG ) of DATE in the version of CARDINAL DATE ( amended in DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE ) , GPE on ORG über die öffentliche GPE , die Berufspflichten , die LOC die GPE der GPE , GPE , ORG , PERSON Dentisten – Heilberufe - Kammergesetz ) of CARDINAL DATE ( amended in DATE and DATE ) , and the Baden - Württemberg Rules of Professional Conduct of ORG in the version of DATE , as amended in DATE ( in force at the material time – recent amendments in DATE ) .

CARDINAL . According to section CARDINAL of ORG , the medical practitioner shall have the care of the health of each individual and of the community as a whole ; he exercises a liberal profession and not a trade or business .

CARDINAL . The medical practitioners practising in GPE constitute the Baden - Württemberg Medical Practitioners’ Council , which is a public - law association ( sections CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of GPE on ORG ) . The functions of ORG include defending the interests of its members and ensuring that they meet their professional obligations ( section CARDINAL of the said Act ) . The ORG adopts decrees concerning inter alia LAW ( section CARDINAL of the said Act ) .

CARDINAL . As regards professional communications , the Baden - Württemberg Rules of Professional Conduct of the Medical Practitioners’ Council , as in force at the material time , provided as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) A medical practitioner is not allowed to advertise his own services or those of other medical practitioners . He shall not instigate or tolerate such prohibited advertising by others . ...

( CARDINAL ) A medical practitioner shall not tolerate the publication of reports or picture - stories on his professional activity with an advertising character , stating his name , showing his photograph or indicating his address . ”

“ Medical publications or the cooperation in informative publications in press , broadcasting or television are permissible if and to the extent that these publications or the medical practitioner ’s cooperation are limited to objective information and neithr the medical practitioner himself nor his activities are presented in the form of an advertisement . In such instances , the medical practitioner is held to ‘ responsible GPE . The same shall apply to public lectures on medical issues . ”

CARDINAL . Sections DATE of GPE on ORG govern the disciplinary powers of the ORG . According to section GPE ) and ( CARDINAL ) , members of these Councils face disciplinary action for professional misconduct ( berufsunwürdige ORG ) , i.e. conduct offending their professional duties as members of the ORG concerned . Pursuant to section DATE , the following disciplinary penalties may be imposed in disciplinary court proceedings : warning , reprimand , a fine of up to DEM CARDINAL,CARDINAL , a loss of membership of ORG other representative bodies or committees of subordinate entities for a period not exceeding DATE , loss of the right to vote and to stand for elections to such organs for a period not exceeding DATE . Disciplinary proceedings are , at first instance , conducted before the district disciplinary courts ( section CARDINAL ) ; an appeal lies against the decision of the district disciplinary court and must be lodged with the disciplinary appeals court ( section CARDINAL ) .
